cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating WNW across the southwest Atlantic and forecast to approach the southeastern U.S. (likely North Carolina/South Carolina) late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Carolinas coast (near southeast North Carolina/South Carolina border)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastline from Georgia through North Carolina most directly in path; Mid-Atlantic coast including Virginia and Maryland could experience indirect effects
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (39–57 mph) are possible at Baltimore late Thu–Fri with peak probability of 17%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (1–2 ft) in the upper Chesapeake Bay is possible if the center tracks farther north, but no significant surge currently forecast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for heavy rainfall exceeding 4 inches Friday–Saturday if Florence’s remnants move north up the Appalachians, leading to freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents expected along the Maryland beaches well ahead of the storm.
